normalised: **Social Media and Influencer Marketing: Collab Craze!**

unnormalised: Brand collaborations are exploding on Indian social media! From Ananya Pandey repping sustainable clothing with local artisans in Jaipur to Virat Kohli endorsing a new line of MRF tyres, everyone's doing it.
normalised: Brand collaborations are exploding on Indian social media! From Ananya Pandey representing sustainable clothing with local artisans in Jaipur to Virat Kohli endorsing a new line of M R F tyres, everyone's doing it.

unnormalised: Forget subtle ads, it's all about shouting it from the rooftops! Influencers are partnering with brands for everything: fashion, food, and even finance! Remember that viral campaign where Chef Lakshmi promoted a new biryani recipe using Swiggy Instamart ingredients? Gen Z lapped it up!
normalised: Forget subtle ads, it's all about shouting it from the rooftops! Influencers are partnering with brands for everything: fashion, food, and even finance! Remember that viral campaign where Chef Lakshmi promoted a new biryani recipe using Swiggy Instamart ingredients? Generation Z lapped it up!

unnormalised: Analysts are saying this trend is fuelled by the relatability factor. People trust their favourite creators more than traditional ads.
normalised: Analysts are saying this trend is fuelled by the relatability factor. People trust their favourite creators more than traditional ads.

unnormalised: This Onam, expect to see a deluge of influencer-driven campaigns for everything from saree brands to travel packages to Kerala. Smart brands are leveraging the festive season to reach a wider audience. We're talking crores of rupees being pumped into these partnerships! The market is predicted to grow by another 30% in the next year alone! Expect even more creative, albeit sometimes questionable, collabs in the coming months! Keep your eyes peeled!
